Great Vid Tim.

To see what a luna eclipse looks like from the Moon, use NASA Eyes application. https://eyes.nasa.gov/index.html
You can use the little telescope icon to place a telescope on the limb of the moon and look towards Earth.
If you speed up time, you see the Earth spin while the sky goes round monthly.
As the Moons orbit is not aligned with the Sun and not perfectly circular, the Earth appears to rise and fall close to the Lunar horizon. Eventually you will notice the Sun going behind the Earth. Thats it; Lunar Eclipse.
